caption: Worth it if you are Corbusier fan but Savoy is the way to go if you have limited time in Paris.

Great example of classic Le Corbusier design. Scale is small and easily accessible. The site to see small but the importance of the work goes beyond the specifics of the site. You need to be well versed in modernism to appreciate the exhibit, but it is well worth the trip.
The english tour was quite long but very informative
For all people like Corbusier. Nice house in the middle of Paris.
Splendid World heritage hidden pearl
architectural masterpiece
A MUST go for architects
Iconic place
Nice for a little walk and a little experience. The house is small

For us architects, it is a unique experience to see a work by Le Corbusier, but I confess that I was a little disappointed with the place, as I was not able to actually visit Corbusier's collection. The tour is limited to Vila Roche and is a self-guided tour. I was quite upset that I was not able to enjoy Le Corbusier's drawings and works.
Maison La Roche, visit during architecture days. Welcome bordering on unpleasant.  For Le Corbusier lovers
It's quite expensive for what it is. We do the visit in 15 minutes and there is not much to see! Probably only architecture lovers would appreciate it.

Really it is unacceptable to charge 10 euros for 10 minutes of visiting this house. No interest, the exhibition of paintings is no longer even visible in this place. No furniture, no decorations, finally nothingness.
Empty Perhaps next time specify the content of the visit which is made for connoisseurs of Le Corbusier

Too expensive for what it is! Positive points: the surrounding area is full of beautiful mansions and the site is in a pleasant green cul-de-sac. The house is undeniably original and modern for its time. Negative points: there is not much to see once you have explored the different rooms (15 - 20 minutes). There is very little furniture, in fairly poor condition, the works presented are rare and uninteresting. In short, €10 per person is scandalous.

Poor reception. No explanations. Not much to see.  Sad, lifeless visit. The tour is very quick and absolutely not worth the 8 euros requested. It's borderline scam. The house, although small, is interesting but without explanations, the architect's bias is incomprehensible. If you open to the public and charge, take care of the public!
It is a beautiful work to visit, unfortunately the fact that entry has a cost is unnecessary.
The genius of Le Corbusier in a house in the heart of Paris. To have !

On GOOGLE it says that the hours are uninterrupted until 6:00 p.m., but the unfriendly doorman has printed a paper saying that he is going to eat at 12:30 p.m. until 1:30 p.m. and everyone out on the street. And there is absolutely NOTHING to do in the area for an hour, it is very residential and very far from tourist circuits. Very bad attention.
Le Cobusier is Swiss, but French by adoption
A place that would have been very interesting to visit. Only the times indicated on the access door do not correspond. So find out before being disappointed
A little small and the trick is done quickly. Too bad there is no furniture or works from the previous owner. Price too high. Honestly not worth the detour.
Does not indicate its annual closure online but only on its storefront. Very unfortunate for a museum which nevertheless seemed very interesting.

We have the impression of going to someone we know, that they open their house to us. The rooms have a very spartan side but the house itself is worth the detour because it is emblematic of the work of Le Corbusier who was quite a character.

Deplorable welcome. Closed between noon and two although this is not indicated on the site. No apologies from the completely unpleasant staff. The schedules are made to be respected, but also to be correctly indicated.
Impressive to be in this place full of history. I don't really understand the criticisms from some people. As far as I'm concerned, I loved it.
A place witnessing modern architecture. Very moving
Key point to understand Le Corbusier's architecture where he applies the 5 principles of modern architecture, there is a lack of biographical material to consult
Architecture students pay 5 or 6 euros! It seemed like they gave a total student discount even if you weren't an arts student.
It is a historic place and you need to understand its context before loving its purist architecture.
Fabulous place not to be missed
It is closed for holidays until August 20, 2018 and it is not indicated on the website. They also do not indicate staff rest from 12:30 to 1:30 p.m.
You feel good there: modulor and warm welcome. My favorite customers at the moment.
Interesting buildings in a quiet neighborhood. But I couldn't get in.
Very interesting work. Friendly and available guide.
House in Paris built by Le Corbusier for a Swiss friend ALL Le Corbusier in this house To have
Availability to inform us of all events
